Class UIUtility

        public static String showMenuOptions​(String menuTitle,
                                     String prompt,
                                     String[] menuOptions)
        Displays a menu and the prompt, returning the String entered by the user.
        Parameters:
        menuTitle - the title of the menu
        prompt - the prompt for input
        menuOptions - the list of menu options to display
        Returns:
        the user's response

      • showErrorMessage

        public static void showErrorMessage​(String message,
                                    boolean waitForAcknowledgement)
        Displays the supplied message. If waitForAcknowledement is true, will also call pressEnterToContinue().
        Parameters:
        message - The error message
        waitForAcknowledgement - true if must press enter to acknowledge

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • showLongText

        public static void showLongText​(String longText)
        Takes a String and shows it, performing line breaks at PAGE_WIDTH intervals. This makes it easier to print really long Strings in a friendly manner.
        Parameters:
        longText - the text to print.

      • getUserString

        public static String getUserString​(String prompt)
        Prompts the user for a String and returns whatever was entered.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt text for the user
        Returns:
        the String entered by the user

      • getUserInt

        public static int getUserInt​(String prompt,
                             String notIntMessage)
        Prompts the user to enter a whole number. If the value is not a whole number, prints the notIntMessage and tries again. Otherwise, returns the int that was entered.
        Parameters:
        prompt - the prompt text for the user
        notIntMessage - the error message for not an int
        Returns:
        the int entered

      • getUserIntInRange

        public static int getUserIntInRange​(String prompt,
                                    String notIntMessage,
                                    int lowBound,
                                    int highBound,
                                    String outOfBoundsMessage)
        Prompts the user for a whole number between the low bound (inclusive) and the high bound (inclusive).
        Parameters:
        prompt - the text of the user prompt
        notIntMessage - the error message for not an int
        lowBound - the lower boundary of the range, inclusive
        highBound - the upper boundary of the range, inclusive
        outOfBoundsMessage - the error message for not in range
        Returns:
        the entered whole number

        public static LocalDate getUserDate​(String prompt)
